thread.title: Top 10 coffee accessories

author: The Telegraph
title: Top 10 coffee accessories
text: With coffee shop culture a firm staple of British life, it’s no surprise coffee has its own annual day of celebration, although for most it’s International Coffee Day every day with one in three of us purchasing a cup at least once a week, equating to more than 17 million people. And it’s not just on the high street – more and more of us are rustling up our own espresso at home. To help you perfect your brew, here’s our 10 favourite coffee accessories. 1. Pitfield Gold Coffee Cup Artwork, £160, pitfieldlondon.com Coffee meet art, art meet coffee. Appreciation of the black stuff doesn’t have to stop with making a brew; make a statement with this bespoke coffee cup screen print in gold leaf. 2. Barista & Co stencils, £10, johnlewis.com Say it with a sprinkle while releasing your inner artist with these quirky coffee stencils. Available in three styles: “wake up”, “hot stuff” and “made with love”. 3. Hario Coffee Beans Roaster, £400, hario.co.uk If you can’t get enough of the aroma of roasting beans, then look no further. Serious enthusiasts can now roast their own in just 15 minutes for the freshest of morning pick-me-ups. 4. Tom Frost, Wildlife Espresso Set, £22.50, magpieline.com Transport yourself to a rural idyll after dinner with these beautiful nocturnal wildlife espresso cups from Tom Dixon’s "Mammals of the British Isles" print collection. 5. Bookman Bike Coffee Cup Holder, £21.99 cyclechic.co.uk For the ultimate coffee on the go, this handy holder snaps on and firmly embraces your cup even on the roughest roads. 6. BIA, Oasis Beverage & Espresso ‘Jars’, £6 & £3, www.notjustjugs.com A reinvention of the original Fifties mason jars, add a little mid-century style to your morning cuppa with these pastel stoneware versions. 7. Tom Dixon Brew Milk Pan, £80, tomdixon.net Tom Dixon’s new Brew collection has the official “phwoar” factor. Engineered from stainless steel with a glossy copper finish, heating milk has never been so sexy. 8. De'Longhi Cappuccino Glasses, box of two, £18.98, delonghi.com These stylish mouth-blown cappuccino glasses have a double wall that allows you to hold the glass without burning your hands while keeping your beverage hot. Perfect for the coffee connoisseur. 9. The Coffee Towel, £11.00, www.trouva.com After attending coffee classes, the humble tea towel is no more. Say hello to the coffee towel, it’ll dry your cups while giving you tips for making a better brew. 10. Villeroy & Boch Demitasse Gold Spoon, £19.50, villeroy-boch.co.uk Give your cutlery drawer the Midas touch with a gold-plated coffee spoon. The decadent way to make a stir.
